page.title: 16BOFARNEL DOWNS
page.content: Farmers in the area are under increasing pressure. Added to normal risks are the twin problems of{E.E.C. quotas and high interest rates. One local farmer had invested heavily in modernising an old farmhouse without electricity and derelict outbuildings. Now he is forced to sell. At Rosevinnick farm there are 92 ewes, 186 lambs and 19 beef cattle. In addition there are 300 ewes grazing through the winter months. The area also contains forestry plantations of fir, pine, spruce, hemlock, cypress and larch mostly planted in the last 25 years. There are rare scenic views from the ridge across to nearby Lostwithiel, Restormel Castle and Lanhydrock House with a cluster of 5 tumuli strengthening a historical theme. Wild orchids, butterflies and squirrels are common.
